items.preText:
Around the wicket now

Baskar: "I don't understand how conveniently everyone forgets that Guptill failed too against India. Anyway, they have Latham who can fill in the opener's shoes may the need come." I reckon they will keep a solid batsman like Latham in the middle order. Also because Guptill doesn't have a stable opening partner right now
items.text: goes across a bit and works it behind square on the leg side for one
a bouncer at 138kmh, he hooks and misses. There's an appeal from Mushfiqur and then Mustafizur joins him too but it's called a wide
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Guptill, no run

items.text: the angle might have worked and Guptill has holed out to deep midwicket. Bouncer from around the wicket outside off, Guptill tries to get on top of it but the extra bounce doesn't let him and it's a top-edge that travels far enough to Liton Das in the deep, a few yards inside the boundary. Another dominating century from Guptill, and the game is almost done for New Zealand

dismissal.text: MJ Guptill c Liton Das b Mustafizur Rahman 118 (126m 88b 14x4 4x6) SR: 134.09

items.text: back of length and angling in, he defends from in front of off stump
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Williamson, no run

items.text: bit of turn after it pitches on off, worked to leg and he's off the mark

items.preText: Williamson takes a fresh guard for some reason
items.text: some width outside off and he punches that off the back foot, says 'yeah, yeah, yeah' and comes back for the second
this one is turning in and he wants two again after helping it to leg but has to settle for one
goes deep in the crease and then whips it to midwicket
goes deep again and this time he gets width, cuts nicely outside off and sends it rolling behind square, spinning away from deep point for four
waits for it and then taps the ball to short third man
slightly full outside off, runs it down to third man for two and that's ODI half-century No. 37 for the captain. This one off 66 balls
bouncer from around the wicket and he ducks under it
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Williamson, no run

items.text: he was initially looking to play at this bouncer but sways out of the line at the last second
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Williamson, no run

items.text: uses soft hands to push the ball from outside off into the covers, sees there's no fielder close to the ball and turns back for the second
angling in towards off stump, defends it back with a straight bat
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Williamson, no run

items.text: stays on the back foot and defends the back of length ball close to himself
items.postText: Time for the last drinks break of the match Nitish: "@Baskar: While i do concur with your option in Latham, and even though he averages a decent 38 as an opener from 37 games, the last time he played as an opener was almost two years ago back in May 2017. It would amount to taking a punt if they were to try him out as a back up opener now. " Venu: "In ipl ,williamson has done really very well as opener and he is good at playing in swing deliveries. For wc he can promote himself as opener and have experienced ross taylor at no 3. Nz have solid middle order as well. "
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Williamson, no run

items.preText: Sabbir comes back after his 13-run first over
items.text: on length on the pads, defends towards midwicket
items.shortText: Sabbir Rahman to Taylor, no run

items.text: just a hint of room on the off side and he cuts it to backward point
items.shortText: Sabbir Rahman to Taylor, no run

items.text: flight and dip for the full delivery on leg, driven down to long-on for one
slightly full outside off, pushed down to long-off easily
hint of turn outside off and it's pushed to long-off again
turning away from outside off, punched through the covers for one
items.postText: Aamir: "@Venu IPL is a different ball game altogether!"

items.preText: Mustafizur continues from around the wicket
items.text: hint of width on off, taps it down to third man for one
bangs a short ball down the leg side, that's a wide
not much room outside off but he taps it towards the covers with soft hands for a quick single. An overthrow from the cover fielder means they turn around quickly for the second
